item.description: Holger Alich Reto Widmer (Name geändert) war nie auf Rosen gebettet. Der 58-Jährige lebt wie seine Eltern zur Miete. Ein Eigenheim ist für ihn nicht drin. item.title: Commerzbank Lines Up €1 Billion Buyback After ECB Approval
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Commerzbank AG is kicking off a share buyback worth as much as €1 billion ($1.2 billion) after securing the necessary approvals from regulators. item.title: Schroders Enters Europe Active ETF Market With Two Fund Launches
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Schroders Plc is launching two active exchange-traded funds in Europe, in a bid to broaden the UK asset manager’s appeal to investors looking for cheaper alternatives to mutual funds. The two funds will invest in global equities and investment-grade corporate bonds respectively, accor...

item.title: ECB’s Cipollone Says Risks to Inflation Are ‘Very Balanced’
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- European Central Bank Executive Board member Piero Cipollone doesn’t see major threats to inflation in either direction, with interest rates currently well positioned. Europe’s economy has been “quite resilient” despite the uncertainty caused primarily by trade, Cipollone told Bloombe...

item.title: ECB Says Cash Is Key in Crises and Supplies Must Be Guaranteed
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Central banks and private lenders must guarantee sufficient access to cash due to its critical importance during times of crisis, the European Central Bank said, signaliing support for the idea of households setting aside an emergency reserve. “The utility of cash intensifies markedly...

item.title: Künstliche Intelligenz: So sehen Commerzbank, Deka & Berenberg Chancen und Risiken
item.author: Bloomberg News (German)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Künstliche Intelligenz ist bei den Banken längst angekommen.
